intro: Euphorbia melanacantha, commonly known as the black-spined euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its thick, ribbed stems and spiny, paddle-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a cyathium, which is typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Due to its striking appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
